newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan tanners protest import duty on chemicals.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan tanners protest import duty on chemicals.

text.p: The private Pakistan Tanners Association (PTA) protested on Thursday against a government decision to impose 10 percent regulatory duty on imports of chemicals used in the production of leather goods.

PTA chairman Shaikh Nasim said in a statement that last month's move by the Central Board of Revenue to slap 10 percent duty on imports of chromium sulphate, fat liquors, and rosin finishes would hurt the leather goods export industry.
Pakistan exported leather and leather goods worth $496.68 million in July-April compared to $471.43 million in the same 1995/96 period, official figures show.
